work.summary: I'm a technology lead and front-end architect/developer at R/GA San Francisco, working with such top-tier clients such as Nike, Microsoft, and HP.
highlights: Lead a team of UI engineers for Nike's global events platform
Developed the first website for Microsoft's Surface tablet
Helped launch the web application for the Nike+ FuelBand fitness tracker
Built interface for and and applied fresh new design to Taco Bell's website
Promoted from Senior Presentation Code Developer

work.summary: At DHAP, I worked on websites for two of the biggest companies in software and cars, Adobe and Toyota.
highlights: Helped develop the first Adobe web application (Marketplace) offering extensions and other add-ons for Air and Photoshop
Maintained and enhanced Lexus.com and other websites for related brands Toyota and Scion using the TeamSite CMS

work.summary: I did front-end development work on large pharmaceutical websites and also managed complex email marketing efforts while at Modem.
highlights: Worked on Java-based patient education websites for Amgen's top-selling rheumatoid arthritis drug Enbrel
Built and launched large email campaigns using the Responsys SaaS solution, then parsed and analyzed resulting data with SQL
Coded cross-client HTML emails for Fortune 500 clients such as Microsoft, Charles Schwab, and Sprint

work.company: Office of Educational Technology, UC San Francisco School of Medicine
highlights: Created content for sites and administered online courses for the large UCSF medical community
Contributed to Ilios, an award-winning, homegrown student calendaring web application based on Classic ASP
